title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: members, contributors, leaders pledge make participation community harassment-free experience everyone, regardless age, body size, visible invisible disability, ethnicity, sex characteristics, gender identity expression, level experience, education, socio-economic status, nationality, personal appearance, race, caste, color, religion, sexual identity orientation. pledge act interact ways contribute open, welcoming, diverse, inclusive, healthy community.

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Examples behavior contributes positive environment community include: Demonstrating empathy kindness toward people respectful differing opinions, viewpoints, experiences Giving gracefully accepting constructive feedback Accepting responsibility apologizing affected mistakes, learning experience Focusing best just us individuals, overall community Examples unacceptable behavior include: use sexualized language imagery, sexual attention advances kind Trolling, insulting derogatory comments, personal political attacks Public private harassment Publishing others’ private information, physical email address, without explicit permission conduct reasonably considered inappropriate professional setting

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Community leaders responsible clarifying enforcing standards acceptable behavior take appropriate fair corrective action response behavior deem inappropriate, threatening, offensive, harmful. Community leaders right responsibility remove, edit, reject comments, commits, code, wiki edits, issues, contributions aligned Code Conduct, communicate reasons moderation decisions appropriate.

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Code Conduct applies within community spaces, also applies individual officially representing community public spaces. Examples representing community include using official e-mail address, posting via official social media account, acting appointed representative online offline event.

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Instances abusive, harassing, otherwise unacceptable behavior may reported community leaders responsible enforcement ando@maslab.aitech.ac.jp. complaints reviewed investigated promptly fairly. community leaders obligated respect privacy security reporter incident.

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Community leaders follow Community Impact Guidelines determining consequences action deem violation Code Conduct:

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Community Impact: Use inappropriate language behavior deemed unprofessional unwelcome community. Consequence: private, written warning community leaders, providing clarity around nature violation explanation behavior inappropriate. public apology may requested.

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Community Impact: violation single incident series actions. Consequence: warning consequences continued behavior. interaction people involved, including unsolicited interaction enforcing Code Conduct, specified period time. includes avoiding interactions community spaces well external channels like social media. Violating terms may lead temporary permanent ban.

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Community Impact: serious violation community standards, including sustained inappropriate behavior. Consequence: temporary ban sort interaction public communication community specified period time. public private interaction people involved, including unsolicited interaction enforcing Code Conduct, allowed period. Violating terms may lead permanent ban.

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Community Impact: Demonstrating pattern violation community standards, including sustained inappropriate behavior, harassment individual, aggression toward disparagement classes individuals. Consequence: permanent ban sort public interaction within community.

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Code Conduct adapted Contributor Covenant, version 2.1, available https://www.contributor-covenant.org/version/2/1/code_of_conduct.html. Community Impact Guidelines inspired [Mozilla’s code conduct enforcement ladder][https://github.com/mozilla/inclusion]. answers common questions code conduct, see FAQ https://www.contributor-covenant.org/faq. Translations available https://www.contributor-covenant.org/translations.

code: @Manual{,   title = {jpaccidents: Tools for Traffic Accident Data in Japan},   author = {Keisuke ANDO},   year = {2025},   note = {R package version 0.1.5},   url = {https://nononoexe.github.io/jpaccidents/}, }

what: Tools for Traffic Accident Data in Japan
title: Tools for Traffic Accident Data in Japan
text: jpaccidents package handling traffic accident data Japan. package covers traffic accident data provided National Police Agency Japan. jpaccidentsは日本の交通事故のデータを扱うためのパッケージです。 このパッケージでは、警察庁が提供する交通事故データを対象としています。

title: Tools for Traffic Accident Data in Japan
text: can install development version jpaccidents like : jpaccidentsの開発版は以下のコマンドからインストールできます。

title: Tools for Traffic Accident Data in Japan
text: Load package follows: パッケージを以下のようにして読み込みます。 traffic accident data can used follows: 交通事故のデータは次のようにして利用することができます。 three types traffic accident data: main (honhyo), sub (hojyuhyo), highway (kosokuhyo) data. package provides functions . Use function appropriate data need. See also ? download_accident_main_data information. 交通事故のデータは本票、補充票、高速票の3種類があります。 それぞれに対応する関数が用意されています。 必要なデータに応じて利用してください。 詳しくは? download_accident_main_dataを参照してください。
code: library(jpaccidents) downloaded_path <- download_accident_main_data(download_dir = "download-dir-path", year = 2022) main_data <- read_accident_main_data(downloaded_path)

title: Tools for Traffic Accident Data in Japan
text: package licensed MIT License - see LICENSE file details. traffic accident data downloaded using package provided National Police Agency Japan Creative Commons Attribution 4.0 International License. このパッケージはMITライセンスの下で提供されています。詳細はLICENSEファイルを参照してください。 また、本パッケージによりダウンロードできる交通事故データは、警察庁によりクリエイティブ・コモンズ 表示 4.0 国際 ライセンスの下で提供されています。

title: Tools for Traffic Accident Data in Japan
text: Please note project released Contributor Code Conduct. participating project agree abide terms. このプロジェクトは行動規範を設けています。 したがって、このプロジェクトでは参加者にこの行動規範に従うことを求めます。

what: Convert DMS (degree-minute-second) to decimal degrees — convert_deg
title: Convert DMS (degree-minute-second) to decimal degrees — convert_deg
text: function converts DMS (degree-minute-second) decimal degrees. input DMS values must format "DDDMMSSsss" : D: Degrees (1–3 digits) M: Minutes (2 digits) S: Seconds (2 digits) s: Milliseconds (3 digits)

title: Convert DMS (degree-minute-second) to decimal degrees — convert_deg
Convert DMS (degree-minute-second) to decimal degrees — convert_deg
text: dms numeric vector DMS values format "DDDMMSSsss"

title: Convert DMS (degree-minute-second) to decimal degrees — convert_deg
text: numeric vector decimal degrees.

title: Convert DMS (degree-minute-second) to decimal degrees — convert_deg

title: Identify dataset names from file paths — detect_dataset_name
text: function identifies dataset names based file paths configuration patterns.

title: Identify dataset names from file paths — detect_dataset_name
Identify dataset names from file paths — detect_dataset_name
text: files character string specifying file paths. quiet logical indicating whether suppress warnings.

title: Identify dataset names from file paths — detect_dataset_name
text: character vector dataset names

title: Identify dataset names from file paths — detect_dataset_name
text: Invalid files replaced NA, warning issued.

title: Identify dataset names from file paths — detect_dataset_name

what: Download the traffic accident data — download_accident_data
title: Download the traffic accident data — download_accident_data
text: Download file traffic accident data provided National Police Agency's Web page.

title: Download the traffic accident data — download_accident_data
Download the traffic accident data — download_accident_data
text: type Type data download: one "main", "sub", "highway". download_dir directory downloaded file saved (default: getwd()). years Years traffic accident data recorded. Available 2019 2023. can specify single year vector years(default: 2023).

title: Download the traffic accident data — download_accident_data
text: Path downloaded file (invisibly).

title: Download the traffic accident data — download_accident_data
text: traffic accident data divided following types: "main" (honhyo): Basic data traffic accidents. "sub" (hojuhyo): Additional data related "main" data. "highway" (kosokuhyo): Data traffic accidents highways. can specify type data directly via type argument.

title: Download the traffic accident data — download_accident_data
Filter data by schema — extract_schema_columns
text: function filters data frame based specified schema, defines columns keep. also handles special case data needs reshaped long format filtering.

title: Filter data by schema — extract_schema_columns
Filter data by schema — extract_schema_columns
text: data accident data object. schema_name character string specifying schema use filtering.

title: Filter data by schema — extract_schema_columns
text: data frame containing columns defined schema, NULL.

title: Filter data by schema — extract_schema_columns
Get configuration — get_config
text: function retrieves configuration loaded using load_config().

title: Get configuration — get_config
Get configuration — get_config
text: list containing configuration.

title: Get configuration — get_config
code: get_config() #> Accident Data Configuration #> --------------------------- #> File types: #>   - main_data: honhyo[_][0-9]{4}[.]csv (72 columns) #>   - sub_data: hojuhyo[_][0-9]{4}[.]csv (16 columns) #>   - highway_data: kosokuhyo[_][0-9]{4}[.]csv (16 columns) #>  #> Schemas: #>   - accident_info: Primary Key = document_type, prefecture_code, police_code, main_id (29 columns) #>   - person_info: Primary Key = document_type, prefecture_code, police_code, main_id, party_order (17 columns) #>   - highway_info: Primary Key = document_type, prefecture_code, police_code, main_id (12 columns)

what: Lookup new column names for an accident dataset — lookup_column_names
title: Lookup new column names for an accident dataset — lookup_column_names
text: function retrieves new column names corresponding original column names specified dataset. column names based configuration loaded load_config(). useful original names Japanese (2-byte characters), can difficult handle programs. function converts corresponding English names.

title: Lookup new column names for an accident dataset — lookup_column_names
Lookup new column names for an accident dataset — lookup_column_names
text: original_names vector original column names.

title: Lookup new column names for an accident dataset — lookup_column_names
text: vector new column names corresponding provided original names, NA unmatched names.

title: Post-process data — post_process
text: post_process() performs post-processing different datasets: post_process_main() handles main data (honhyo) separating accident person data. post_process_sub() handles sub data (hojuhyo), processing person-related information. post_process_highway() handles highway data (kosokuhyo), extracting highway-related information.

title: Post-process data — post_process
code: post_process(data)  # S3 method for class 'accident_data' post_process(data)  post_process_main(data)  post_process_sub(data)  post_process_highway(data)

title: Post-process data — post_process
text: data data processed.

title: Post-process data — post_process
text: processed dataset list.

title: Post-process data — post_process
text: functions process data based type, ensuring consistency proper formatting.

what: Read accident data from CSV files — read_accident_data
title: Read accident data from CSV files — read_accident_data
text: function reads accident data multiple CSV files, processes file, combines data three categories: accident_info: Basic accident information including date, location, conditions person_info: Information individuals involved accidents highway_info: Information specific accidents occurred highways/expressways

title: Read accident data from CSV files — read_accident_data
Read accident data from CSV files — read_accident_data
text: file_paths character vector file paths CSV files. apply_post_process Logical. TRUE (default), applies post-processing steps clean standardize data. FALSE raw data frames.

title: Read accident data from CSV files — read_accident_data
text: list containing three data frames apply_post_process = TRUE (accident_info, person_info, highway_info). apply_post_process = FALSE, returns either single data frame list raw data frames (multiple files).

title: Read accident data from CSV files — read_accident_data
Reset Configuration — reset_config
text: function resets configuration default values.

title: Reset Configuration — reset_config
Reset Configuration — reset_config

what: Translate codes to human-readable labels using configuration data — translate_code
title: Translate codes to human-readable labels using configuration data — translate_code
text: translate_code() translates codes corresponding human-readable labels based configuration data. supports English Japanese languages. code found configuration data, issue warning return NA.

title: Translate codes to human-readable labels using configuration data — translate_code
Translate codes to human-readable labels using configuration data — translate_code
text: code character vector codes converted labels. concept string specifying concept category (e.g., "impact_part") lang string specifying output language. Default "en". Supported values "en" (English) "ja" (Japanese).

title: Translate codes to human-readable labels using configuration data — translate_code
text: character vector length input codes, containing corresponding labels. Invalid codes converted NA warning.

title: Translate codes to human-readable labels using configuration data — translate_code
code: # Convert a single code translate_code("1", "impact_part") #> [1] "front"  # Convert multiple codes translate_code(c("1", "2"), "impact_part") #> [1] "front" "right"  # Convert codes with Japanese labels translate_code("1", "impact_part", "ja") #> Error in translate_code("1", "impact_part", "ja"): unused argument ("ja")  # Handle invalid codes translate_code(c("1", "999"), "impact_part") #> ! In concept impact_part, The following code(s) is not registered: 999 #> [1] "front" NA
